intro: Hesperis alpina, commonly known as the alpine honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Hesperis alpina is often found in meadows, rocky slopes, and alpine tundra, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
